388 
 
COURSE/DEGREE AWARDING 
INSTITUTIONS  
REQUIREMENTS    
UTME SUBJECTS  
 SPECIAL CONSIDERATION (WAIVER) REMARKS  
DIRECT ENTRY  UTME  
with options in:  English, Religious Studies,  
Economics Education, Social Studies  
Education  
 PHC      
with options in English, History, French,  
Theatre Arts, Fine Arts and design,  
Religious AND Cultural Studies  
YOSU  
With options in  
i. Islamic Studies ii.  
History iii.  English  iv.  
Arabic   
TSUJ  
UYO      
  
    credit or its equivalent in English Language at 'O' level 
or its equivalent.  
For Education/English, 'O' level credit passes in English 
Language and Literature in English are compulsory For 
Education/History, Government or History is 
compulsory  
For Education/French - French is compulsory.  
For Education/Igbo Linguistics, Igbo is compulsory.   
 Candidates for Education Music, Education/Creative Arts 
and Education Fine and Applied Arts must possess Music, 
Creative Art or Fine and Applied Arts respectively at O' level, 
in addition to five (5) Credit passes at a sitting or six (6)‘O’ 
level credit passes at two (2) sittings which must include 
English Language. (iv) CALABAR accepts 'O' level pass in 
Mathematics.  
(v) NDU requires five (5)'O’ level credit passes i n English 
Language, Mathematics, and any other three (3) 
subjects, two (2) of which must be Arts subjects at not 
more than two (2) sittings.  
  
  
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) PHC and EBSU - The subjects of study and two (2) other 
relevant subjects.  
(ii) English Language, the subject to be combined and two  
(2) other Arts or SocialScience subjects. For Ed/Music,  
Education/Creative Art and Education/Fine and 
Applied Arts, English Language and three (3) other Arts 
subjects.  
(iii) UNN requires the subject to be combined and two (2 ) 
other Arts or Social Science subjects. For Education 
Music/Education Fine Arts; any three (3) other subjects.
